definition: lit. made by Heaven and arranged by Earth(idiom)/ideal/perfect/(of a match) made in heaven/to be made for one another
day/sky/heaven
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display

sentences.english: Jo and Ian are a perfect match for each other.
sentences.chinese: 喬和伊恩真是天造地設的一對兒。

sentences.english: Don: that they're a match made in heaven?
sentences.chinese: 他們是天造地設的一對？

sentences.english: Jack and Mary are cut out for each other.
sentences.chinese: 傑克和瑪麗真是天造地設的一對。

sentences.english: I think we are made for each other.
sentences.chinese: 我想我們是天造地設的一對。

sentences.english: " He called the proposed acquisition a "marriage made in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 他稱該項收購提議是一個“天造地設的良緣”。

sentences.english: This is almost a match made in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 這絕對是天造地設的一對。

sentences.english: Everybody had the impression that she was a good match for the young man.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都覺得她和那年輕人是天造地設的一對。
我們倆是天造地設的一對。

sentences.english: You see two people, they belong together, but nothing happens.
sentences.chinese: 你會看到天造地設的兩個人，卻始終沒能在一起。

sentences.english: For coffee lovers, chocolate and coffee are a match made in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 對於咖啡愛好者，巧克力和咖啡真是天造地設的絕配。

sentences.english: Jim: Oh, I'm sorry , I thought you two were made for each other.
sentences.chinese: 哦，對不起，我認爲你們是天造地設的一對。

definition: to convert an enemy into a friend (idiom)
coastal erosion/marine abrasion
to cross (a road, an ocean etc)/to cut across
snow line
flying squirrel/(dialect) bat
lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
a golden house to keep one's mistress (idiom); a magnificent house built for a beloved woman
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
source of calamity (esp. of women)
root of Chinese pulsatilla/Chinese bulbul
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
(bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
